description: Latin suus (“belonging to himself or oneself”).

entries.meaning: One who seeks for things which gratify merely himself; a selfish person; a selfist.
examples: […]  rather than alter his pace, or path (that Conscience or Reason boundeth him in) he will bee poor, undone; any thing but the Ratio formalis, essentiall of a Suist, or selfe-polititian, that is changeable.
